result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevon S. Reid was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case Called: 1:37 pm
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher in person:
Defendant appears in custody, in person, and with Atty Heather Roehr in person;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
PLEA:
Ct. 1 (Obstructing an Officer)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 2 (Obstructing an Officer)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 3 (Obstructing an Officer)>> NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding. Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 1 (Obstructing an Officer)>> $25 Fine plus Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. 
Ct. 2 (Obstructing an Officer)>> Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. 
Ct. 3 (Obstructing an Officer)>> Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge.
